Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type A kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx to right (lower part of forelegs, hind legs and rump missing; trace of red blob on body); part of rosette, rising triangle and undetermined motif at top left as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Type A kantharoi are decorated with two friezes between vertical dividing bands. The painter omitted the tip of the wing and the top of the sphinx's head, perhaps intentionally.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1655) (phase 2)
